author: Edriss Scofield

text:
What amazes me about this -- I'd never heard of it before -- is how much Hot Head Bop fits in with DKC2's soundtrack, and goes beyond DKC1's more simple atmospherics.


IMO, it's almost like Wise was growing as a composer as he made the soundtrack to DKC1, and took 2 in this new (even better) direction.

text: I think you two have some interesting points, but I think you're right overall. Graphics were important back then. But unlike today's games, graphics were the not the ONLY thing stressed, and that's why video games back then seem to be on another level. EVERYTHING was stressed: Music, graphics, gameplay, and storyline. But at the same time, I think that some recent have stressed several factors instead of just graphics too. I guess graphics is a factor that's easier to notice.

text: @KisukeFreak ThereasonVGM sound so ick these days when compared to older VGM isn'tbecause the composers stopped caring.It's because the freshness has faded.This was atimewhen VGMs started sounding more realistic.The whole concept was new,andit will alway have a special place in your memories.When comparing something like that to something today,there HAS to be some bias in there.The 90s had great,if not the greatest VGM composers.But todays music is just as well composed with fancier instruments

author: 54spiritedwill54

text:
They do, but it seems less and less common.  I believe they use lots of computer-themed sounds during the music for the LOGBOX-720 world in Nuts & Bolts, for instance.  But that's the only recent example I can think of.

Of course, I haven't played Kameo, and it's quite possible there, but... *Shrug* It's kind of a shame.
author: Garlyle Wilds

text:
That's the interesting thing about Rareware. They like to add ambiance to some of their level music tracks to make it sound more organic and lively. 

I'm not sure if they still do that or not though...
Do they? If they don't because they were bought out by Microsoft, then they're missing a classic element of Rare.

author: spartan7326

text:
Hot Head Top--Lava World
Arctic Abyss-- Ice World
Pirate Panic-- 1st Pirate Level
Jib Jig (Rigging)-- 2nd Pirate Level
Lockjaw's Locker-- 3rd Pirate Level (low deck of ship)
Forest Interlude-- Haunted Forest level
Stickerbrush Symphony (Bramble Blast)
Bayou Boogie (Swamp/Pond Levels)
Hornet Hole (Beehive levels)
Krook's March (Castle level theme)
Kannon's Klaim (Mine Theme from Lava world)
Disco Train (Carnival/Circus level)
